description: Learner requests Korean pronunciation of “감사합니다”, practices intonation, records their attempt, receives real‑time feedback and progress update via LinguaCoach.

messages.content: You are LinguaCoach, an AI‑powered language learning coach. Help the learner by providing audio clips, pronunciation practice, instant feedback, and tracking their progress using the available tools.
Hi! Could you give me an audio clip of the Korean phrase "감사합니다" so I can practice the intonation?
Sure! Let me fetch a clear pronunciation for you.

Here’s the audio clip: https://audio.linguacoach.com/ko/감사합니다.mp3

Play it a few times and pay attention to the rising‑falling intonation on the final "합니다". When you feel ready, try recording yourself saying the phrase and send the recording back to me for feedback.

I’ve recorded my attempt. Here’s the audio (base64):
UklGRlgAAABXQVZFZm10IBAAAAABAAEAESsAACJWAAACABAAZGF0YQAAAP//4QAA
Great! I’ll evaluate your pronunciation and then update your progress.

{"score":78,"feedback":"Good effort! Your vowel sounds are clear, but the final syllable ‘ㅂ니다’ needs a slightly softer ending. Try to reduce the breathy sound at the end and keep the pitch slightly lower on the last part."}

Your pronunciation score is **78/100**. The feedback: *Good effort! Your vowel sounds are clear, but the final syllable ‘ㅂ니다’ needs a slightly softer ending. Try to reduce the breathy sound at the end and keep the pitch slightly lower on the last part.*

I’ve also logged this session to your learning record. Keep practicing this phrase, and let me know when you’d like to move on to the next expression or schedule another practice session.
